The claim states that Maryland: s electors ignored the statewide vote and gave the presidency to Hillary Clinton. The expert's verdict confirms that this claim is false and provides evidence to support this by stating that Hillary Clinton already won Maryland's ten electoral votes in the 2016 presidential election.
The expert: s verdict further mentions that the proposal to change the manner in which presidential electors are selected in Maryland was never implemented because other states did not go along with it. This information counters the claim that Maryland had rejected the Electoral College system and awarded its electors to the winner of the national popular vote.
Additionally: the expert's verdict mentions that the claim is nonsensical as it suggests that Maryland giving Hillary Clinton its electoral votes would have changed the election results, even though she had already won the state's electoral votes in the 2016 presidential election. This aspect highlights the illogical nature of the claim and further supports its lack of authenticity.
